/v2/addresses/<address>/compose/bet.description: Composes a transaction to issue a bet against a feed.

args.name: address
args.description: The address that will make the bet (e.g. $ADDRESS_1)

args.name: feed_address
args.description: The address that hosts the feed to be bet on (e.g. $ADDRESS_2)

args.name: bet_type
args.description: Bet 0 for Bullish CFD (deprecated), 1 for Bearish CFD (deprecated), 2 for Equal, 3 for NotEqual (e.g. 2)

args.name: deadline
args.description: The time at which the bet should be decided/settled, in Unix time (seconds since epoch) (e.g. 3000000000)

args.name: wager_quantity
args.description: The quantities of XCP to wager (in satoshis, hence integer) (e.g. 1000)

args.name: counterwager_quantity
args.description: The minimum quantities of XCP to be wagered against, for the bets to match (in satoshis, hence integer) (e.g. 1000)

args.name: expiration
args.description: The number of blocks after which the bet expires if it remains unmatched (e.g. 100)

args.name: leverage
args.description: Leverage, as a fraction of 5040

args.name: target_value
args.description: Target value for Equal/NotEqual bet (e.g. 1000)

args.name: encoding
args.description: The encoding method to use

args.name: fee_per_kb
args.description: The fee per kilobyte of transaction data constant that the server uses when deciding on the dynamic fee to use (in satoshis)

args.name: regular_dust_size
args.description: Specify (in satoshis) to override the (dust) amount of BTC used for each non-(bare) multisig output.

args.name: multisig_dust_size
args.description: Specify (in satoshis) to override the (dust) amount of BTC used for each (bare) multisig output

args.name: pubkeys
args.description: The hexadecimal public key of the source address (or a comma separated list of keys, if multi-sig). Required when using encoding parameter values of multisig or pubkeyhash.

args.name: allow_unconfirmed_inputs
args.description: Set to true to allow this transaction to utilize unconfirmed UTXOs as inputs

args.name: exact_fee
args.description: If you'd like to specify a custom miners' fee, specify it here (in satoshis). Leave as default for the server to automatically choose

args.name: fee_provided
args.description: If you would like to specify a maximum fee (up to and including which may be used as the transaction fee), specify it here (in satoshis). This differs from fee in that this is an upper bound value, which fee is an exact value

args.name: unspent_tx_hash
args.description: When compiling the UTXOs to use as inputs for the transaction being created, only consider unspent outputs from this specific transaction hash. Defaults to null to consider all UTXOs for the address. Do not use this parameter if you are specifying inputs_set

args.name: dust_return_pubkey
args.description: The dust return pubkey is used in multi-sig data outputs (as the only real pubkey) to make those the outputs spendable. By default, this pubkey is taken from the pubkey used in the first transaction input. However, it can be overridden here (and is required to be specified if a P2SH input is used and multisig is used as the data output encoding.) If specified, specify the public key (in hex format) where dust will be returned to so that it can be reclaimed. Only valid/useful when used with transactions that utilize multisig data encoding. Note that if this value is set to false, this instructs counterparty-server to use the default dust return pubkey configured at the node level. If this default is not set at the node level, the call will generate an exception

args.name: disable_utxo_locks
args.description: By default, UTXOs utilized when creating a transaction are 'locked' for a few seconds, to prevent a case where rapidly generating create_ calls reuse UTXOs due to their spent status not being updated in bitcoind yet. Specify true for this parameter to disable this behavior, and not temporarily lock UTXOs

args.name: p2sh_pretx_txid
args.description: The previous transaction txid for a two part P2SH message. This txid must be taken from the signed transaction

args.name: segwit
args.description: Use segwit

args.name: confirmation_target
args.description: The number of blocks to target for confirmation

args.name: exclude_utxos
args.description: A comma-separated list of UTXO txids to exclude when selecting UTXOs to use as inputs for the transaction being created

args.name: inputs_set
args.description: A comma-separated list of UTXOs (`<txid>:<vout>`) to use as inputs for the transaction being created

args.name: return_psbt
args.description: (API v2 only) Construct a PSBT instead of a raw transaction hex

args.name: return_only_data
args.description: (API v2 only) Return only the data part of the transaction

args.name: extended_tx_info
args.description: (API v1 only) When this is not specified or false, the create_ calls return only a hex-encoded string. If this is true, the create_ calls return a data object with the following keys: tx_hex, btc_in, btc_out, btc_change, and btc_fee

args.name: old_style_api
args.description: (API v1 only) Returns a single hex-encoded string instead of an array

args.name: use_utxos_with_balances
args.description: Use UTXO with balances

args.name: exclude_utxos_with_balances
args.description: Exclude silently UTXO with balances instead of raising an exception

args.name: validate
args.description: Validate the transaction

args.name: verbose
args.description: Include asset and dispenser info and normalized quantities in the response.

args.description: Specify (in satoshis) to override the (dust) amount of BTC used for each (bare) multisig output

args.name: pubkeys
args.description: The hexadecimal public key of the source address (or a comma separated list of keys, if multi-sig). Required when using encoding parameter values of multisig or pubkeyhash.

args.name: allow_unconfirmed_inputs
args.description: Set to true to allow this transaction to utilize unconfirmed UTXOs as inputs

args.name: exact_fee
args.description: If you'd like to specify a custom miners' fee, specify it here (in satoshis). Leave as default for the server to automatically choose

args.name: fee_provided
args.description: If you would like to specify a maximum fee (up to and including which may be used as the transaction fee), specify it here (in satoshis). This differs from fee in that this is an upper bound value, which fee is an exact value

args.name: unspent_tx_hash
args.description: When compiling the UTXOs to use as inputs for the transaction being created, only consider unspent outputs from this specific transaction hash. Defaults to null to consider all UTXOs for the address. Do not use this parameter if you are specifying inputs_set

args.name: dust_return_pubkey
args.description: The dust return pubkey is used in multi-sig data outputs (as the only real pubkey) to make those the outputs spendable. By default, this pubkey is taken from the pubkey used in the first transaction input. However, it can be overridden here (and is required to be specified if a P2SH input is used and multisig is used as the data output encoding.) If specified, specify the public key (in hex format) where dust will be returned to so that it can be reclaimed. Only valid/useful when used with transactions that utilize multisig data encoding. Note that if this value is set to false, this instructs counterparty-server to use the default dust return pubkey configured at the node level. If this default is not set at the node level, the call will generate an exception

args.name: disable_utxo_locks
args.description: By default, UTXOs utilized when creating a transaction are 'locked' for a few seconds, to prevent a case where rapidly generating create_ calls reuse UTXOs due to their spent status not being updated in bitcoind yet. Specify true for this parameter to disable this behavior, and not temporarily lock UTXOs

/v2/addresses/<address>/compose/order.description: Composes a transaction to place an order on the distributed exchange.

args.name: address
args.description: The address that will be issuing the order request (must have the necessary quantity of the specified asset to give) (e.g. $ADDRESS_1)

args.name: give_asset
args.description: The asset that will be given in the trade (e.g. XCP)

args.name: give_quantity
args.description: The quantity of the asset that will be given (in satoshis, hence integer) (e.g. 1000)

args.name: get_asset
args.description: The asset that will be received in the trade (e.g. $ASSET_1)

args.name: get_quantity
args.description: The quantity of the asset that will be received (in satoshis, hence integer) (e.g. 1000)

args.name: expiration
args.description: The number of blocks for which the order should be valid (e.g. 100)

args.name: fee_required
args.description: The miners’ fee required to be paid by orders for them to match this one; in BTC; required only if buying BTC (may be zero, though) (e.g. 100)

args.name: encoding
args.description: The encoding method to use

args.name: fee_per_kb
args.description: The fee per kilobyte of transaction data constant that the server uses when deciding on the dynamic fee to use (in satoshis)

args.name: regular_dust_size
args.description: Specify (in satoshis) to override the (dust) amount of BTC used for each non-(bare) multisig output.

args.name: multisig_dust_size
args.description: Specify (in satoshis) to override the (dust) amount of BTC used for each (bare) multisig output

args.name: pubkeys
args.description: The hexadecimal public key of the source address (or a comma separated list of keys, if multi-sig). Required when using encoding parameter values of multisig or pubkeyhash.

args.name: allow_unconfirmed_inputs
args.description: Set to true to allow this transaction to utilize unconfirmed UTXOs as inputs

args.name: exact_fee
args.description: If you'd like to specify a custom miners' fee, specify it here (in satoshis). Leave as default for the server to automatically choose

args.name: fee_provided
args.description: If you would like to specify a maximum fee (up to and including which may be used as the transaction fee), specify it here (in satoshis). This differs from fee in that this is an upper bound value, which fee is an exact value

args.name: unspent_tx_hash
args.description: When compiling the UTXOs to use as inputs for the transaction being created, only consider unspent outputs from this specific transaction hash. Defaults to null to consider all UTXOs for the address. Do not use this parameter if you are specifying inputs_set

args.name: dust_return_pubkey
args.description: The dust return pubkey is used in multi-sig data outputs (as the only real pubkey) to make those the outputs spendable. By default, this pubkey is taken from the pubkey used in the first transaction input. However, it can be overridden here (and is required to be specified if a P2SH input is used and multisig is used as the data output encoding.) If specified, specify the public key (in hex format) where dust will be returned to so that it can be reclaimed. Only valid/useful when used with transactions that utilize multisig data encoding. Note that if this value is set to false, this instructs counterparty-server to use the default dust return pubkey configured at the node level. If this default is not set at the node level, the call will generate an exception

args.name: disable_utxo_locks
args.description: By default, UTXOs utilized when creating a transaction are 'locked' for a few seconds, to prevent a case where rapidly generating create_ calls reuse UTXOs due to their spent status not being updated in bitcoind yet. Specify true for this parameter to disable this behavior, and not temporarily lock UTXOs

args.description: The previous transaction txid for a two part P2SH message. This txid must be taken from the signed transaction

args.name: address
args.description: The address that will be issuing the asset (e.g. $ADDRESS_1)

args.name: asset
args.description: The asset to issue (e.g. MYASSET)

args.description: The parent asset of the asset to issue

args.name: price
args.description: The price in XCP of the asset to issue (e.g. 10)

args.name: quantity_by_price
args.description: The quantity of asset to mint per `price` paid

args.name: max_mint_per_tx
args.description: Amount minted if price is equal to 0; otherwise, maximum amount of asset that can be minted in a single transaction; if 0, there is no limit

args.name: hard_cap
args.description: The maximum amount of asset that can be minted; if 0 there is no limit

args.description: Amount of asset to be minted when the sale starts, if 0, no premint; preminted assets are sent to the source of the transaction

args.description: The block at which the sale starts

args.name: end_block
args.description: The block at which the sale ends

args.description: Minimum amount of asset to be minted, if None, no minimum; if the soft cap is not reached by the soft_cap_deadline_block, the sale is canceled, asset is revoked from all minters and all payments are refunded

args.name: lock_quantity
args.description: If True, the quantity of the asset cannot be changed after the minting

args.name: divisible

args.name: description
args.description: The description of the asset. Overrides the current description if the asset already exists.

args.description: If you would like to specify a maximum fee (up to and including which may be used as the transaction fee), specify it here (in satoshis). This differs from fee in that this is an upper bound value, which fee is an exact value

args.name: unspent_tx_hash
args.description: When compiling the UTXOs to use as inputs for the transaction being created, only consider unspent outputs from this specific transaction hash. Defaults to null to consider all UTXOs for the address. Do not use this parameter if you are specifying inputs_set

args.name: dust_return_pubkey
args.description: The dust return pubkey is used in multi-sig data outputs (as the only real pubkey) to make those the outputs spendable. By default, this pubkey is taken from the pubkey used in the first transaction input. However, it can be overridden here (and is required to be specified if a P2SH input is used and multisig is used as the data output encoding.) If specified, specify the public key (in hex format) where dust will be returned to so that it can be reclaimed. Only valid/useful when used with transactions that utilize multisig data encoding. Note that if this value is set to false, this instructs counterparty-server to use the default dust return pubkey configured at the node level. If this default is not set at the node level, the call will generate an exception

args.name: disable_utxo_locks
args.description: By default, UTXOs utilized when creating a transaction are 'locked' for a few seconds, to prevent a case where rapidly generating create_ calls reuse UTXOs due to their spent status not being updated in bitcoind yet.
